intro: Plerandropsis bonii, commonly known as the African violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. Plerandropsis bonii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
